titles.title: A bill to provide additional personnel authorities for the Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Lieberman without amendment. With written report No. 111-15.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 53.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Mr. Faleomavaega moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 615.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: 6/30/2009--Public Law. Amends the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2008 to authorize the Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction to exercise certain employment and employment-related authorities currently permitted for the heads of temporary organizations established by law or executive order.
